channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.description:

item.title: Report I-2024120021
item.description:
Report I-2024120021

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was offloading bleach and the gaging system stopped at 5/8 and the tank overfilled at the end cap releasing 15 gallons of material, with a portion going into containment. The overfill gage was not easily identifiable/dirty. The driver cleaned up the spill and notified EHS and dispatch. No Exposures/Injuries.

item.title: Report E-2024120027
item.description:
Report E-2024120027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-27
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 27, 2024, one (1) 25-pound bag of UN1477 was torn and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE utilized a shop vacuum with a HEPA filter to remove the free-standing product. All ammonium nitrate impacted materials and damaged cargo were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2024120005
item.description:
Report E-2024120005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-27
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 27, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released three (3) gallons of paint to the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all waste in two (2) 55-gallon drums.
